definition: interlocking wooden brackets between the top of a column and crossbeams used in traditional Chinese architecture
abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]
to cup one's hands in salute/to surround/to arch/to dig earth with the snout/arched

sentences.english: Suspended Peak, five stamping on the Dougong, Liangjia Basilica structure and a slightly different approach.
sentences.chinese: 悬山顶，五踩斗拱，梁架结构与大殿做法略有不同。

sentences.english: Under the eaves brackets, ridge eaves are decorated with patterns.
sentences.chinese: 檐下有斗拱，脊檐皆饰有图纹。

sentences.english: It also introduces relations between the bucket arch and modern building modular.
sentences.chinese: 及斗拱与现代建筑模数的关系。

sentences.english: Bracket set is a kind of unique components in architecture of Chinese ancient wood structure .
sentences.chinese: 斗拱是中国古代木结构建筑上的一种特有的构件。

definition: Buddhist ornamentation decorating the upper story of a pagoda
